channel.title: Comments on: LulzSec has shut down, has ended hacking campaign
channel.description: A Technical Community for IT Professionals

item.title: By: calin oprea
item.dc:creator: calin oprea
item.description: Yeap, Denis is optimistic with his view; since Sony sliced and diced their own security department, I wonder how far will they go for profit and cutting costs.
item.content:encoded: Yeap, Denis is optimistic with his view; since Sony sliced and diced their own security department, I wonder how far will they go for profit and cutting costs.

item.title: By: chopstik
item.dc:creator: chopstik
item.content:encoded:
Denis, I think you’re an optimist. Very few people (including technical people or management) learn from the mistakes of others until they are bitten by those same mistakes. After each hack, there was yet another company making the same mistakes that was then also hacked. If they can’t fix it at the time, what makes you think they’ll remember it two months from now and fix it then?

Or maybe I’m just being cynical today…
